main event: On 29 September 1958 in Alaska, a civilian observed two large glowing balls of fire, with one disappearing and creating a crater on the ground before reappearing in the air.
interesting points: The observation lasted for approximately 1 minute on the ground and 1 minute in the air.
Witnesses reported varying colors of the objects, ranging from white to green, and described them as resembling a giant firecracker or a faded object with a long tail.
There was no sound associated with the sighting, and the objects appeared to be at a very low altitude.
The objects were observed flying away in different directions, including moving south, northeast, and west to east.
The report includes a request to check with the University of Alaska to determine if a large meteor had entered the Earth's atmosphere around the time of the sightings.
sighted object: two large glowing balls of fire
